Wednesday Round-up: 27th January

This afternoon's scores from matches involving the University of York's sports teams (Thumbnail credit Action from the rugby seconds' exciting win over Newcastle this afternoon. Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Hockey Firsts cruise into quarter-finals

Wednesday's 2-0 win over local rivals St. John bodes well both for Varsity next month and the firsts' chances of silverware this season (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Volleyball men end season with thrilling victory

In their last game of the season, York men's volleyball firsts recovered from going a set behind to beat Liverpool John Moores 3-1. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

News in Brief

A round-up of other happenings in the world of sport at the University of York this week (Thumbnail credit College football was again postponed this weekend. Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Emily Scott

Emily Scott announces the new plans for Varsity at the end of February

The 21st-Century Ace

By James Bithell

Sports Editor Adam Shergold talks with Paul Bonhomme, the reigning champion of the Red Bull Air Race (Thumbnail credit Photographs: Tom Lovelock/Red Bull Air Race Via AP Images)

Derwent netball bounce back to form

Derwent, the defending champions, returned to form on Sunday with a 13-8 win over Vanbrugh in the College Netball (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Water polo women lose to superb Leeds

York faced stacked odds even before they jumped in the pool with a Leeds side containing national standard players, the 13-1 defeat frustrating but hardly unsurprising (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Irene Sieberger)

Rugby firsts set for promotion battle

Following last week's 18-12 victory over Leeds Met, the men's rugby firsts have positioned themselves nicely for an assault at the title in BUCS League 1A. Leigh Clarke assesses their chances (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

James and Alcuin gain early points as Emperor league gets underway

James and Alcuin showed why they remain College Rugby's elite teams with two resounding wins in the first round of Emperor College Rugby Championship fixtures (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Triple Yorkshire League success for Hockey Club

Comprehensive wins for the men's firsts and seconds, plus the women's seconds, over the weekend boosted York's chances of promotion in the local league (Thumbnail credit Billy Walsh, pictured here in BUCS action against Durham, was central to many of the firsts' training ground routines against Leeds University. Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Football fourths' epic comeback stuns Huddersfield

Three-nil down inside ten minutes, the UYAFC fourths battled back in impressive style to shock Huddersfield and make it three wins from four. (Thumbnail credit Photographs by Peter Iveson)

The Nouse Sports Podcast

By James Bithell

We are proud to present the first edition of the Nouse Sport Podcast. Each week we will endeavour to bring top class analysis and reaction to all the biggest sporting events both on and off campus.

Men's rugby firsts cruise past Carnegie seconds

Two tries from Richard Bremner and another from Rory McGregor meant that York ran out 18-12 victors in an impressive display against Leeds Met. Carnegie seconds. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Sam Newsome)

Men's badminton send out uncompromising message ahead of Roses

The badminton firsts didn't show Lancaster any mercy on Wednesday afternoon, not dropping a rubber on the way to an 8-0 rout. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

Football firsts one step closer to their New Year's resolution

This afternoon's gritty 2-1 home win against Leeds Met, earned through goals from Conor Brennan and Ian McKellow, has taken the UYAFC firsts top of the table (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)

Wednesday Round-up: 20th January

The results from this afternoon's sports action at the University of York. (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Sam Newsome)

York Ultimate hoping to build on positives from Kalingrad Open

By James Bithell

Following a fifth place finish in this tournament, staged in the Tent last weekend, York's Ultimate Frisbee team can look forward to forthcoming regional competitions and Roses. (Thumbnail credit Photographs courtesy of York Ultimate)

Team success for York at UPC Nine-Ball Pool Championships

By James Bithell

York beat Manchester to win their first-ever team championship at the Universities Pool Council Nine-Ball Championship, staged in Liverpool in December, to cap a fine weekend of success. (Thumbnail credit Luke Fleet, Runner-up in the Individual Championship)

Dropping Pietersen would boost his England career

Kevin Pietersen's Test career has stalled and would only be reignited if he lost his place in the England team.

Controlled ball tampering could rebalance test cricket

Test cricket has become too biased towards the batsman in recent years. Deliberate manipulation of the ball could restore fear in the bowler, argues Huw Harrow.

Luke is the Wright man for the second Test

England must pick Luke Wright if they are to improve their attack in the second Test at Durban.

James win Emperor College Rugby Championship

James have won the Emperor College Rugby Championsip after beating Alcuin in the deciding fixture at York R.I. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Women's Football: Just like Hovis, you get the best of both...

Miriam Swaffield offers an alternative view of Wednesday's women's football clash with Northumbria (Thumbnail credit Photographs by Peter Iveson)

Halifax crowned College Football champions

A 4-1 victory over Derwent on the final afternoon of the College Football League was more than sufficient to wrap up the title, as Alcuin were held. (Thumbnail credit Tom Ragan (in the air) and Jack Beadle (right), pictured here against Wentworth, were both on the scoresheet today. Photograph by Justyn Hardcastle)

Women's rugby put St. John to the sword

York showed their near neighbours little mercy on Wednesday afternoon, the 41-0 away success sending a statement of intent in BUCS League 2B (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Jessica Roy)

Gaining the services of Bradley Wiggins is a tremendous coup for Team Sky

Dave Brailsford has acted shrewdly in bringing Olympic gold medalist and Tour de France tyro Bradley Wiggins to Team Sky, believes Jake Farrell

Late comeback not enough for men's basketball as Leeds gain revenge

There was no disgrace in York's 74-66 defeat to Leeds University seconds on Wednesday, with the team remaining well-placed in BUCS League 3B (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Rachel Elgar)

Classy football fourths end year on a high with Bradford rout

Wednesday's 4-1 success over Bradford suggested there is much more to come from Alex Collins' team in the New Year

Netball seconds too good for league leaders Newcastle

York announced their promotion credentials with a 38-32 win against table-toppers Newcastle, a result which narrows the gap between the teams to three points in League 5B (Thumbnail credit Photograph by Peter Iveson)
